Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit with some organic (?) inclusions, the exterior (now worn) is covered with a red-brown slip and bears the remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393290) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393290)
